intro: Endodeca sempervirens, commonly known as the evergreen fern, is a perennial plant characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant features feathery, lance-shaped fronds that remain green throughout the year. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its unique botanical structure makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and ecological restoration projects.
